column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This correspond to the URL that points to the page where a new bug can be created on the Bug system of the application.

The following variables can be used inside the URL
%TEST%Test
%TESTCASE%Test case reference
%TESTCASEDESC%Description of the test case
%EXEID%Execution ID
%EXEDATE%Start date and time of the execution.
%ENV%Environment
%COUNTRY%Country
%BUILD%Build
%REV%Revision

column.value:

Les variables suivantes peuvent être utilisées dans l'URL
%TEST%Test
%TESTCASE%Reference du cas de test
%TESTCASEDESC%Description du cas de test
%EXEID%ID de l'execution
%EXEDATE%Date et heure du debut de l'execution.
%ENV%Environnement
%COUNTRY%Pays
%BUILD%Build
%REV%Revision

The following variables can be used inside the URL

Correspond à l'URL du Bug Tracker de l'application.

Les variables suivantes peuvent être utilisées dans l'URL

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This information groups the application by typology of deployement process.
It can be used as a variable in the parameter jenkins_deploy_url that correspond to the URL that calls a continious integration system such as Jenkins.

column.value:
Cette information groupe les applications par typologie de deploiement.
Peut être utilisé comme variable dans le parametre jenkins_deploy_url qui correspond à l'URL appelée vers un systeme d'intégration continue de type Jenkins.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the short Description of the application.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This correspond to an integer value that is used as a sorting criteria for various combo box within Cerberus GUI.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: A Subsystem define a group of application inside a system.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Le Sous système regroupe un ensemble d'application au sein d'un même système.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
A system is a group of application for which all changes sometimes require to be done all together.
Most of the time those applications all connect to a single database and share the same data structure.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Un système est un groupe d'applications pour lesquels il y a de temps en temps necessité de faire les changements en même temps.
La plupart du temps ces applications partagent une même base de donnée et donc une structure de donnée unique.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
The Type of the application define whether the application is a GUI, a Service or a Batch Treatment.
An automated testcase based on a GUI application will require a selenium server to execute.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Le type de l'application defini si l'application est une interface graphique (GUI), un fournisseur de Service ou un traitement batch.
Un cas de test automatisé basé sur une application de type GUI necessitera un serveur Selenium pour s'executer.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the name of the JDBC Ressource used to connect to the corresponding database on the country / environment.
The JDBC Ressource (prefixed by jdbc/ ) needs to be configured and associated to a connection pool on the application server that host the Cerberus application.

Example :
JDBC RessourceApplication server Ressource name
MyConnection jdbc/MyConnection

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Nom de la ressource JDBC utilisée pour se connecter à la base de donnée correspondant au pays / environnement.
La ressource JDBC (préfixée par jdbc/ ) doit être configuré dans le serveur l'application qui héberge Cerberus et associé à un pool de connexion.

Exemple :
JDBC RessourceApplication server Ressource name
MyConnection jdbc/MyConnection

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Domain of the Application. Can be used inside any test execution with %SYS_APP_DOMAIN% variable.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Domaine Internet de l'application. Peut être utilisé pendant l'execution des tests avec la variable %SYS_APP_DOMAIN%.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Ressource location of the application.

Examples :
www.domain.com
192.168.1.1:80
user:password@www.domain.com:8080
user:password@192.168.1.1:80
http://www.laredoute.fr
https://www.facebook.com

NB : If the protocol is not specified, the default selected is http://
In case you want to test an https:// application, this ressource location must begin by https://.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Chemin de l'application.

Exemples :
www.domain.com
192.168.1.1:80
user:password@www.domain.com:8080
user:password@192.168.1.1:80
http://www.laredoute.fr
https://www.facebook.com

NB : Si le protocole n'est pas specifié, le protocople par default utilisé est http://
En cas de test d'une application en https, il faut commencer l'URL par https://.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Root URL used to access the application. Equivalent to context root.
This path will always be added to the information specified in the testcase.

Example :
URLDescription
/Cerberus-1.0.1-SNAPSHOT/When opening login.jsp, Cerberus will open /Cerberus-1.0.1-SNAPSHOT/login.jsp URL

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
URL Racine de l'application. Equivalent du Context Root.
Ce chemin sera systematiquement ajouté aux chemin specifiés dans chaque cas de test.

Exemple :
URLDescription
/Cerberus-1.0.1-SNAPSHOT/Lorsque l'on ouvrira login.jsp, Cerberus ouvrira /Cerberus-1.0.1-SNAPSHOT/login.jsp URL

column.value: EMail Body on New Chain Executed Event

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the Body of the mail that will be generated when a new Treatment has been executed on the environment.

The following variable can be used
%SYSTEM%System value
%COUNTRY%Country code
%ENV%Environment code
%BUILD%Current Build version name
%REVISION%Current Revision version name
%CHAIN%Chain value that has been executed

In case that value is not feeded, the following parameter is used :
integration_notification_newchain_body

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Corps du message en cas de nouvelle Chaine

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: EMail Body on Disable Environment Event

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the Body of the mail that will be generated when environment is disabled for installation purpose.

The following variable can be used
%SYSTEM%System value
%COUNTRY%Country code
%ENV%Environment code
%BUILD%Current Build version name
%REVISION%Current Revision version name

In case that value is not feeded, the following parameter is used :
integration_notification_disableenvironment_body

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Corps du message en cas de désactivation

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: EMail Body on New Build/Revision Event

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the Body of the mail that will be generated when a new Build/Revision is installed on the environment.

The following variable can be used
%SYSTEM%System value
%COUNTRY%Country code
%ENV%Environment code
%BUILD%Current Build version name
%REVISION%Current Revision version name
%BUILDCONTENT%Detailed content of the sprint/revision.
That include the list of release of every application.
%TESTRECAP%A summary of test cases executed for that build and revision for the country.
%TESTRECAPALL%A summary of test cases executed for that build and revision for all the countries.


In case that value is not feeded, the following parameter is used :
integration_notification_newbuildrevision_body

column.value: Corps du message en cas de nouvelle Revision

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the activation flag of the daily maintenance period.
In case the flag is activated, start and end times needs to be specified.
During a maintenance period, the environment is considered as disable and Cerberus will prevent the test case from beeing executed.

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Activation de la plage de maintenance

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the time when the daily maintenance period ends.
If start time is before end time then, any test execution request submitted between start and end will be discarded with an explicit error message that will report the maintenance period and time of the submission.
If start is after end then any test execution request submitted between end and start will be possible. All the overs will be discarded with an explicit error message that will report the maintenance period and time of the submission.

Examples :
flagstartendResult
Yes23:00:0023:30:00Any execution between 23H00 and 23H30 will be discarded.
Yes23:00:0002:30:00Any execution between 23H00 and 2H30 will be discarded.
No23:00:0023:30:00All executions will be authorised.

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Heure de fin de la plage de maintenance

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the time when the daily maintenance period starts.
If start is before end then, any test execution request submitted between start and end will be discarded with an explicit error message that will report the maintenance period and time of the submission.
If start is after end then any test execution request submitted between end and start will be possible. All the overs will be discarded with an explicit error message that will report the maintenance period and time of the submission.

Examples :
flagstartendResult
Yes23:00:0023:30:00Any execution between 23H00 and 23H30 will be discarded.
Yes23:00:0002:30:00Any execution between 23H00 and 2H30 will be discarded.
No23:00:0023:30:00All executions will be authorised.

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Heure de début de la plage de maintenance

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
The type of the environment define what is the environment used for.

'STD' Standard Testing is allowed in the environment.

'COMPARISON' Only Comparison test case is allowed to be executed on the environment. No other test cases is allowed to execute. This is to avoid modifying any data on the environment and not beeing able to analyse easilly the differences between 2 Build/Revisions.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
A country is a declination of a system in an environment with a specific configuration.
This is called country because for systems that support multiple countries, every country is deployed on different environments. Each of them can have the same version of the application but with different configuration. As a consequence, some test case may or may not be relevant on that country.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Un pays est une declinaison d'un système dans un environnement avec une configuration specifique.
Ca porte le nom de pays car pour les systèmes qui supportent plusieurs pays, chaque pays est deployé sur un environnement different. Chacun d'entre eux peut avoir la même version de l'application mais avec differentes configuration. En conséquence, certain cas de test peuvent ou non etre pertinant sur ce pays.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Number of days to Filter the history table in the integration status.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
The group is a property of a test case that can take the following values :

AUTOMATED : The test case is fully automated and does not require any manual action.
MANUAL : The test case has to be manually executed.
PRIVATE : The test case exist for technical reason and will never appear on the reporting area. For example : Pre Testing test cases that are used for login purpose should all be PRIVATE.
PROCESS : The test case is related to specific process and needs some intermediate batch treatment to be fully executed.
COMPARATIVE : Test cases that compare the results of 2 batch executions inside the database by SQL requests.

column.value: Manual Execution is the way to execute the test case. It could be YES to manually execute all kind of test case, or NO to execute if automatically.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the format of the output.

gui : output is a web page. If test can be executed, the output will redirect to the test execution detail page.
compact : output is plain text in a single line. This is more convenient when the test case is executed in batch mode.
verbose-txt : output is a plain text with key=value format. This is also for batch mode but when the output needs to be parsed to get detailed information.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This define whether Page Source will be recorded during the execution of the test.

0 : No Page Source are recorded. This is to be used when a massive amout of tests are performed.
1 : Page Source are taken only when action or control provide unexpected result.
2 : Page Source are always taken on every selenium action. This is to be used only on very specific cases where all actions needs to take page source (For debug mode for example.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Define the number of Retry of the Execution in case of Not OK status.
As soon a OK status if reached, the engine stop to retry to execute the testcase.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This define whether screenshots will be taken during the execution of the test.

0 : No screenshots are taken. This is to be used when a massive amout of tests are performed.
1 : Screenshots are taken only when action or control provide unexpected result.
2 : Screenshots are always taken on every selenium action. This is to be used only on very specific cases where all actions needs a screenshot.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the size of the browser screen that will be set for the execution.

Default Values are set inside the invariant SCREENSIZE that can be configured on Edit Public invariant screen..
Value must be two Integer splitted by a * mark.
For Exemple : 1024*768

If you need to add other Values, please contact your Cerberus Administrator.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This define whether Selenium Log will be recorded during the execution of the test.

0 : No Selenium Log are recorded. This is to be used when a massive amout of tests are performed.
1 : Selenium Log are taken only when action or control provide unexpected result.
2 : Selenium Log are always taken on execution. This is to be used only on very specific cases where all actions needs to take Selenium Log (For debug mode for example.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Selenium Server IP is the IP of the computer where the selenium server is running.
This also correspond to the IP where the brower will execute the test case.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Selenium Server Port is the port which will be used to run the test case.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is parameter to define if user mut be redirected to the reporting during the execution.

By default, synchroneous will be set to Y, meaning the redirection will be at the end of the execution.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the timeout used for the execution.

If empty, the default value will be the one set in the parameter table.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
The Test Data Library is a repository of test data that centralises and eases the Test Data Management process. Additionally, it eases the creation of test cases because it allows the reuse of data that is recurrently defined.

Cerberus allows the definition of three types of entries: STATIC, SQL and SOAP.

The definition of each library entry comprises two steps:

  • The definition of the library entry.
  • The definition of its sub-data entries.

column.value: A test is grouping some test case together. The criteria that groups the test cases can be an application page or a feature.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Define whether the test case can be executed in PROD environments.
If the environment gp1 (attached to the invariant) is PROD and Active PROD is No, the test case will never be executed.

If the environment gp1 (attached to the invariant) is QA and Active QA is No, the test case will never be executed.

If the environment gp1 (attached to the invariant) is UAT and Active UAT is No, the test case will never be executed.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
It is the workflow status of the test case used to follow-up the implementation of the tests.
It can take any values depending on the workflow that manage the test case life cycle.

The first status defined on the invariant table (based on the sequence) will be the default value for any new test case.
The only status that is mandatory to define and create is the WORKING status that correspond to fully working and stable test case.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the Target Build that should fix the bug. Until we reach that Build, the test case execution will be discarded.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the Revision that should fix the bug. Until we reach that Revision, the test case execution will be discarded.

column.value: This field define if the test is active or not. A test case that is not active cannot be executed.

column.value: This is the test case creation date.

column.value: A test case is a scenario that test a specific feature of an application.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Database where the SQL will be executed.
This is only applicable if the property type is executeSql or executeSqlFromLib.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
It is the length parameter of the property.
The parameter usage depend on the type of the property.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Nature is the parameter which define the unicity of the property calculation for this testcase in every execution.

It can take the following values :

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: NOTINUSE : When the property return a list of value, NOTINUSE will take a value on the list that is not already used on a pending execution in the last 10 minutes.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: RANDOM : When the property return a list of value, RANDOM will take a random value on the list. It could be the same accross 2 different executions.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: RANDOMNEW : When the property return a list of value, RANDOMNEW will take a random value on the list. RANDOMNEW garantee that the same value will never be selected twice on the same test case, country, environment and build (NB : revision is not part of the criterias).

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: STATIC : The property could/must be the same for all the executions

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the reference of the property.

A property is a data string that can be calculated in any moment during the test case. Property can be defined directly inside the test case but also calculated dynamically from an SQL or even read from the current html page.

When property is attached to an action, the associated action is executed only if the property exist in the country.

Once a property has been calculated, its value can be reused in any other property, action and controls using % before and after its reference.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
When the property calculation return a list of value, Rowlimit will limit the number of rows considered for random purposes.

For example, in 100 possible random values if rowLimit is 50, only the 50 first values will be accounted for random.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the type of command which will be used to calculate the property.

It can take the following values :

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a value from an SQL execution.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
executeSQL will allow you to execute an SQL Query (Value) on the DTB Database.

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBValue of the database that correspond to the connection pool where the SQL will be executed.
ValueSQL instruction to be executed. All system and property variables can be used.
LengthNot used
RowLimitUsed depending on the Nature.
NatureNature to be used for unicity constrain.


Example :
DTBValueNatureDescription
AS400DataSELECT customer FROM table;RANDOMOne of the customer value returned by the SQL will be used.
MySQLDataSELECT user FROM toto;STATICThe first user of toto table will be used.

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a value from an SQL execution from the library.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
executeSQLFromLib will allow you to execute an SQL Query on the DTB Database from a library of SQL.
This type has the same behaviour as executeSQL type except that the SQLs are gathered from a library of SQL.

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBValue of the database that correspond to the connection pool where the SQL will be executed.
ValueReference of the SQL instruction stored inside SQL Library.
LengthNot used
RowLimitUsed depending on the Nature.
NatureNature to be used for unicity constrain.


Example :
DTBValueNatureDescription
AS400DataCUSTOMER1RANDOMOne of the customer value returned by the SQL attached to CUSTOMER1 will be used.
MySQLDataUSER1STATICThe first value of the 1st column of the SQL attached to USER1 SQL will be used.

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get an attribute value from an HTML field in the current page.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getAttributeFromHtml will allow you to take an attribute value from an html field on the current webpage.
Cerberus will automatically wait for the field to start to appear before getting the attribute value.
The different attributes identifier that can be used in order to find the HTML field are : id, name, class, css, xpath, link, and data-cerberus.
Syntax is as follow :
identifier=html-value

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
ValueIDENTIFIER=HTML-VALUE
Value2ATTRIBUTE
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
HTMLValueValue2Result
id=Namesrctoto.jpeg
data-cerberus=ctl00nameinputName

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getFromCookie will allow you to get information on cookie.

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
Value1Cookie Name.
In case the cookie is not found, empty string will be returned.
Value2Information on cookie.
It could be name, value, expiry, domain, path, isHttpOnly, isSecure.
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
Value1Value2Result
COOKIE_NAMEvalueCOOKIE_VALUE
COOKIE_NAME2Expiry01-01-2015
COOKIE_NAME3hostwww.cerberus-testing.org

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a value from the current web page.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getFromHtml will allow you to take a value from an html field on the current webpage.
Cerberus will automatically wait for the field to start to appear before getting the value.
Different attributes identifier can be used in order to find the field : id, name, class, css, xpath, link, and data-cerberus.
Syntax is as follow :
identifier=html-value

NB : getFromHtml will get the value of the field even if it does not appear on the web page (this is not the standard behaviour of Selenium).

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
ValueIDENTIFIER=HTML-VALUE
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
HTMLValueResult
id=NameFRONT1
name=crb-nameCERBERUS
data-cerberus=ctl00toto

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a visible value from the current web page.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getFromHtmlVisible will allow you to take a visible value from an html field on the current webpage.
Cerberus will automatically wait for the field to start to appear before getting the value.
Different attributes identifier can be used in order to find the field : id, name, class, css, xpath, link, and data-cerberus.
Syntax is as follow :
identifier=html-value

NB : getFromHtmlVisible will return an empty value if the field does not appear on the web page (this is the standard behaviour of Selenium).

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
ValueIDENTIFIER=HTML-VALUE
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
HTMLValueResult
id=Name
name=crb-name
data-cerberus=ctl00toto

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a value from the output of a javascript execution.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getFromJS will allow you to calculate a string from a javascript execution.
Using this feature, you can use the full power of javascript in order to calculate values in the context of the current page.

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
ValueJavascript to execute.
In case the javascript return no value, empty string will be returned.
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
ValueResult
return s.products == undefined || s.products.toLowerCase().split('event16=').length == 1 ? '' : 'fail_case';fail_case
return GetCookie('UserIdentificationId') == undefined ? '' : GetCookie('UserIdentificationId');
return s.eVar5 == undefined ? '' : s.eVar5;
return new Date().getTime().toString() + "@cerberus-testing.org";1391154967143@cerberus-testing.org

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a value from a Json File

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getFromJson will allow you to take an element value from a Json File.
Cerberus will download the Json File (Calling the URL in the Value1 field) and parse it to return the element value expected (Specified in the Value2 field).

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
ValueURL of the Json File
Value2Element to Find
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
Json FileValueValue2Result
http://url_of_the_json/file.jsontext21234
http://url_of_the_json/file.jsonarray[1]second

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a value from Cerberus Test Data.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getFromTestData will allow you to get a string from the Cerberus Test Data value from the key.

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
ValueKey of the data to retrieve.
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
ValueResult
%SYS_ENV%customernb1Data corresponding to PRODcustomernb1 key if execution from PROD.

column.name: DocLabel
column.value: Get a value from an XML file.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
getFromXml will allow you to get value from an XML file specifying the URL of the file and the xpath to eecute to get the data.

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
Value1URL to the Xml file to parse.
Value2xpath information to get data.
LengthNot used
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNot used.


Examples :
Parsing a file www.cerberus-testing.org/test.xml which contains an xml structure with ResponseCode element equals to OK and ResponseValue equals to 12345, it should be configured that way:
Value1Value2Result
www.cerberus-testing.org/test.xml//ResponseCodeOK
www.cerberus-testing.org/test.xml//ResponseValue12345

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
text will allow you to calculate a string.
Using the Nature, random string can also be calculated.

Usage :
FieldUsage
DTBNot used.
ValueText.
LengthSize of the string if Nature is STATIC.
RowLimitNot used.
NatureNature to be used for unicity constrain. Only Static and RANDOM (or RANDOMNEW) are used.


Examples :
ValueNatureLengthResult
totoSTATIC0toto
toto%SYS_COUNTRY%titiSTATIC0totoPTtiti
totoRANDOM5a5Gx3

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Value of the property. Depend on the type of property chosen.

Get more information on type field.

The following system variables can be used
%SYS_SYSTEM%System value
%SYS_APPLI%Application reference
%SYS_APP_DOMAIN%Domain of the Application
%SYS_ENV%Environment value
%SYS_ENVGP%Environment group code
%SYS_COUNTRY%Country code
%SYS_COUNTRYGP1%Country group1 value
%SYS_SSIP%Selenium server IP
%SYS_SSPORT%Selenium server port
%SYS_TAG%Execution tag
%SYS_EXECUTIONID%Execution ID
%SYS_TODAY-yyyy%Year of today
%SYS_TODAY-MM%Month of today
%SYS_TODAY-dd%Day of today
%SYS_TODAY-doy%Day of today from the beginning of the year
%SYS_TODAY-HH%Hour of today
%SYS_TODAY-mm%Minute of today
%SYS_TODAY-ss%Second of today
%SYS_YESTERDAY-yyyy%Year of yesterday
%SYS_YESTERDAY-MM%Month of yesterday
%SYS_YESTERDAY-dd%Day of yesterday
%SYS_TODAY-doy%Day of yesterday from the beginning of the year
%SYS_YESTERDAY-HH%Hour of yesterday
%SYS_YESTERDAY-mm%Minute of yesterday
%SYS_YESTERDAY-ss%Second of yesterday
%SYS_ELAPSED-EXESTART%Number of milisecond since the start of the execution.
%SYS_ELAPSED-STEPSTART%Number of milisecond since the start of the execution of the current step.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the browser that was used to run the test case (only used if that was a GUI application test case).

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the full version information of the browser that was used to run the test case (only used if that was a GUI application test case).

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the message reported by Cerberus on the execution of the test case.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the return code of the Execution. It can take the following values :

OK : The test case has been executed and everything happened as expected.
KO : The test case has been executed and reported an error that will create a bug.
NA : The test case has been executed but some data to perform the test could not be collected (SQL returning empty resultset).
FA : The test case failed to execute because there were an error inside the test such as an SQL error. The test case needs to be corrected.
CA : The test case has been cancelled. It failed during the execution because of technical issues (ex. Lost of connection issue to selenium during the execution)
PE : The execution is still running and not finished yet or has been interupted.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the version of the Cerberus Engine that executed the test case.
This data has been created for tracability purpose as the behavious of Cerberus could varry from one version to another.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This is the name of the executor user that executed the test case.
This data has been created for tracability purpose as the result of Cerberus Test could varry between human and selenium test.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the ip of the machine of the Selenium Server where the test case executed.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the port used to contact the Selenium Server where the test case executed.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the real size of the browser screen that performed the execution of the test case.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This correspond to the status of the test case when it was executed.
This is used to identify executions done on stable test case compared to the ones done on draft version.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: The Tag is just a string defined by the user that will be recorded with the execution. Its purpose is to help to find back some specific executions.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Full URL used to connect to the application.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
This correspond to the level if information that Cerberus will keep when performing the execution. It can take the following values :

0 : The test will keep minimum login information in order to preserve the response times. This is to be used when a massive amout of tests are performed. No details on action will be saved.
1 : This is the standard level of log. Detailed action execution information will also be stored.
2 : This is the highest level of detailed information that can be chosen. Detailed web traffic information will be stored. This is to be used only on very specific cases where all hits information of an execution are required.

NB : Verbose level higher that 0 rely on Network traffic (only available on firefox browser).

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: This is the Value of the calculated Property.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Number of css downloaded for all the scenario

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Size of the biggest css dowloaded during the scenario

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Total size of the css for the scenario

column.name: DocDesc
column.value: Cumulated time for download css for all the scenario

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
callSoapWithBase will allow you to make a SOAP call (Stored on the SoapLibrary) using the servicePath stored at the countryenvrionmentparameters level. That allow to call the soap on the environment of the execution.

The result will be stored in the memory. On this result, you can make some control (verify the presence or the content of the elements for exemple) or get some information using property getFromXML

FieldUsage
ObjectName of the SOAP from the SOAPLibrary.
Property

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
select : When the action expected is to select a value from a select box.

How to feed it :

Action = select, Value = the id of the select box. and Property = the property containing the value to select.
It could be label=TheExactNameOfTheValue or value=the first letter or the place number of the value expected in the select box
For example : label=WEB , value=W , value=3 if the WEB is the third value in the selectbox

Edit EntryAllows the update of the library entry: system, environment, country, type, group, database, script, method, service path, envelope and description. The name is not editable.
Delete EntryAllows the deletion of a library entry (and its sub-data entries). Only the entries that are not being used are possible to be deleted.

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Entry Type - Cerberus allows the definition of three types: STATIC, SQL and SOAP.

TypeDescription
STATICStatic test data - in each execution the values used by the test cases do not vary.
SQL Test data obtained from a SQL execution – values depend on what is stored in the database.
SOAPTest data obtained from a SOAP call – values depend on the web service implementation.

column.name: DocDesc

column.name: DocDesc
column.value:
Authorities are managed by group. In order to be granted to a set of feature, you must belong to the corresponding group.
Every user can of course belong to as many group as necessary in order to get access to as many feature as required.
In order to get the full access to the system you must belong to every group.
Some groups are linked together on the test perimeter and integration perimeter.

Test perimeter :

TestRO: Has read only access to the information related to test cases and also has access to execution reporting options.

Test: Can modify non WORKING test cases but cannot delete test cases.

TestAdmin: Can modify or delete any test case (including Pre Testing test cases). Can also create or delete a test.

The minimum group you need to belong is TestRO that will give you access in read only to all test data (including its execution reporting page).
If you want to be able to modify the testcases (except the WORKING ones), you need Test group on top of TestRO group.
If you want the full access to all testcase (including beeing able to delete any testcase), you will need TestAdmin on top of TestRO and Test group.

Test Data perimeter :

TestDataManager: Can modify the test data..

Test Execution perimeter :

RunTest: Can run both Manual and Automated test cases from GUI.

Integration perimeter :

IntegratorRO: Has access to the integration status.

Integrator: Can add an application. Can change parameters of the environments.

IntegratorNewChain: Can register the end of the chain execution. Has read only access to the other informations on the same page.

IntegratorDeploy: Can disable or enable environments and register new build / revision.

The minimum group you need to belong is IntegratorRO that will give you access in read only to all environment data.
If you want to be able to modify the environment data, you need Integrator group on top of IntegratorRO group.
IntegratorNewChain and IntegratorDeploy are used on top of Integrator Group to be able to create a new chain on an environment or perform a deploy operation.

Administration perimeter :

Administrator: Can create, modify or delete users. Has access to log Event and Database Maintenance. Can change Parameter values.

Hello to all.

Use of environment %ENV% for country %COUNTRY% with Sprint %BUILD% (Revision %REVISION%) has been disabled, either to cancel the environment or to start deploying a new Sprint/revision.
Please don't use the VC applications until you receive further notification.

If you have any question, please contact us at mail@mail.com

Cumprimentos / Regards / Cordialement,

Test and Integration Team
